item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Kurt Vonnegut speaking to John Irving while Irving was administering the Heimlich maneuver in response to Vonnegut's uncontrollable coughing..."John,stop- I am not choking. I have emphysema." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by ~Mary Oliver, "Wild Geese"
item.description: "Whoever you are, no matter how lonely, the world offers itself to your imagination, calls to you like the wild geese, harsh and exciting-over and over announcing your place in the family of things." -- ~Mary Oliver, "Wild Geese"

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "If we are to reach real peace in the world, we shall have to begin with the children." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Katherine Dunn
item.description: "When your mama was the geek, my dreamlets," Papa would say, "she made the nipping off of noggins such a crystal mystery that the hens themselves yearned toward her, waltzing around her, hypnotized with longing." -- Katherine Dunn

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I write this sitting in the kitchen sink." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Barrabas came to us by sea, the child Clara wrote in her delicate calligraphy. " -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "My suffering left me sad and gloomy." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Wade Davis
item.description: "The world in which you were born is just one model of reality. Other cultures are not failed attempts at being you; they are unique manifestations of the human spirit." -- Wade Davis

item.title: Kathryn add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Tonight I can write the saddest lines I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda
